creditline: Gift from the Collection of John and Robyn Horn
medium: Wood, paint with lacquer and graphite
text: As in much of Betty Scarpino's work, this piece is a visual and metaphorical contrast. Scarpino turns wood as a functional plate would be made, then bleaches and paints the grain to create a strong black and white design.  With its sliced form and its own pedestal, Scarpino's plate is stepping out of its functional role and into sculpture.
title: Stepping Out of Line, from the Altered Plates Series
